alert.note: Alert for Dunn (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 8:39PM CDT until April 12 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota... Knife River at Manning affecting Dunn County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Knife River at Manning. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...A flood of 14.89 ft created problems and required sandbagging of rural homes in 2009. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Tuesday /6:00 PM MDT Tuesday/ the stage was 15.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage by Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.5 feet on 04/01/1987. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
